","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":2,"updated_at":"2025-02-28T18:31:41.733Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":87,"readers_count":86,"score":32.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":493649,"topic_slug":"i-dont-know-how-to-put-the-encoder-on-the-tank-traction-can-anyone-help-me","display_username":"Samuel ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69542,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Federal Force"},"post_url":"/t/i-dont-know-how-to-put-the-encoder-on-the-tank-traction-can-anyone-help-me/493649/1","custom_user_title":"Federal Force","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3543763,"name":"","username":"Hollisms","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hollisms/{size}/110925_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-28T20:26:28.673Z","cooked":"

If you are using brushless motors (Krackens, Neo, etc.) use their built in encoders.

If you are using CIMs, etc. you basically have two options. One is to use a through bore encoder where you run an axle through the encoder. The other option is that the you install a magnet on the end of an axle or some gearboxes have a special place to attach the encoder and magnet.

Depending on your goals, etc. I would consider using an IMU (gyro) to make the robot drive straight and then use time to implement an auto. Once that is working then add the encoders to implement something more intricate.

Assuming that is why you are asking…
